channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Incredible Shrinking Presidency
item.description: The powers of our tech billionaires will soon exceed those granted to our chief executive.

item.title: Kamala Harris Won’t Win Gen Z Voters Like Me With Memes And Vibes
item.description: This is a presidential election, not a vote on who should be the next member of the Hype House.

item.title: Jeff Bezos Is Right
item.description: The first step on the road to recovery is admitting that one has a problem.

item.title: Biden targeted in GOP resolution condemning 'garbage' remark about Trump supporters

item.title: Fox News Democracy '24: The keys to the count in every battleground state
item.description: Each of the seven swing states has unique rules affecting how and when votes are counted on Election Day.

item.title: Seven Lies Kamala Harris Packed Into 22-Minute Harrisburg Rally
item.description: Supporters spent more time finding decent parking than listening to their candidate speak.

item.title: Transhumanism Hasn’t Been The Paradise Mankind Thought It Would Be
item.description: If the long-awaited advent of the cyborg world is upon us, we will be forced to consider whether this is really what we want.

item.title: YUGE Gift to the Clark Art Institute: Philanthropy at Its Best
item.description: 331 works of art and $45 million from a trustee’s estate will transform one of America’s best small museums.

item.title: Mexico Is Holding Back A Massive Wave Of Illegal Immigrants That Will Break After The Election
item.description: Here's what I learned walking among and interviewing a caravan of 1,000 migrants about Mexico's plans after Nov. 5.

item.title: The Call of Lovecraft
item.description: His work deserves to endure, as it certainly will. But not as a worldview unto itself.

item.title: The McReagan in the Election
item.description: The McReagan parable tells us a few things about our own past, and even about the policy that made that past worthy of a little nostalgia.
